summary: Build a beginner-friendly ICP/Web3 onboarding web app that creates a user ID and badge on first login, maintains a registrant database, and links to an external Web2 site describing the ICP real-world network initiative (with an events/coming-soon page for next steps).
architectural_notes: Plan a new 'Planet/Digital World' visualization page that reflects registrant count in real time and adds a new visible 'inhabitant' representation for each new registrant.
Configure the OISY wallet URL to open https://oisy.com (avoid 'Wallet link is not configured' warning).
Define how the points system is managed 'with my profile' (e.g., self-managed vs admin/allowlisted management) and where the UI lives in the profile page.
known_issues: Deployment/publish-to-live step failed previously (“publish step hit a snag” / build error); user requested retry.

Live frontend URL https://5cpxd-piaaa-aaaap-qib3q-cai.icp0.io returns “Canister ID Not Resolved” (gateway can’t resolve destination canister), suggesting deployment did not actually succeed or canister/domain mapping is missing.
OISY wallet link shows 'Wallet link is not configured' because the wallet URL is not set.

existing_features.title: Implement Internet Identity authentication so users can sign in/out and the app can associate a registrant record with the signed-in principal.
Build a registration form UI for Web3 novices that collects and edits a registrant profile and saves it to the backend.
Add a public (read-only) directory page that displays the registrant database entries with search and filtering suitable for browsing novices.
Add an admin-style management capability limited to a configurable allowlist of principals to moderate the registrant database (e.g., remove entries that are spam).

Apply a coherent, creative visual theme across the app (layout, typography, spacing, and colors) appropriate for a beginner-friendly Web3 onboarding directory; avoid blue/purple as the primary palette.
Add generated static image assets and render them in the UI (store under frontend/public/assets/generated) for branding and the landing page hero.

Update the frontend to display a user’s progression (current level and/or XP) in an appropriate place (e.g., on the registration/profile area and/or in the directory cards) using the new backend APIs, while keeping the UI optional and non-blocking if progression is not configured yet.

Update the frontend to fetch and display the user’s issued ID and badge when they are authenticated, including immediately after first login, without blocking the existing profile setup/registration flow.
Add navigation and content that links the app to the external Web2 website (www.dmc-technologies.fr) so users can learn more about the project and its objective: creating an ICP real-world network.
Create an Events (or Coming Soon) page that explains the next step is coming soon after the first step (creating an ID), and add it to the app navigation.

Deploy the current application to the Internet Computer (live environment) and provide the resulting public access address (URL) for the frontend, along with the deployed canister IDs (frontend + backend) needed to reference the deployment.

Diagnose and fix the issue that prevents the app from being published/deployed to the Internet Computer mainnet (the previous "publish step hit a snag" failure), so that a `dfx deploy --network ic` completes successfully for both backend and frontend canisters.
Deploy the current application to the Internet Computer (mainnet) and provide the resulting public frontend URL and both canister IDs (frontend + backend).
Re-run the Internet Computer deployment so the frontend URL is reachable and provide the resulting working public frontend URL plus both canister IDs (frontend + backend).

Diagnose and fix the root cause of the gateway error “Canister ID Not Resolved” when opening `https://5cpxd-piaaa-aaaap-qib3q-cai.icp0.io`, ensuring the deployed frontend canister/domain mapping is correct after redeploy.
Deploy the current Draft Version 6 build to the Internet Computer (IC) network and provide the resulting public frontend URL plus both deployed canister IDs (frontend and backend).

After deployment, verify that the deployed frontend is correctly mapped to the deployed frontend canister ID (no domain/canister mismatch) and document any remediation steps taken if a mismatch is detected.

Add a new page that visualizes the community as a digital world: render a 3D planet and show an inhabitant representation for each registrant; also display the total inhabitant count equal to the total number of app signups/registrations.

Expose a backend query API that returns the total number of registrants (signups) without requiring the frontend to fetch and count the full registrant list, and consume it from the new Digital World page via a new React Query hook.

Make the visualization feel like “each new member appears”: when the registrant total increases, add new inhabitant visuals with an entry animation; keep placement deterministic and stable across refreshes (so existing inhabitants do not jump).
Add navigation access to the new Digital World page from the app header navigation and ensure the mobile menu also includes it.

Add a user-facing entry point in the app header navigation (desktop + mobile menu) that lets authenticated users open their OISY wallet from within the app via an external link (new tab) with safe target/rel attributes.
Provide a configurable OISY wallet URL that the frontend uses for the wallet navigation link, and show a clear, non-blocking UI message if the URL is not configured.

Configure the OISY wallet navigation item so that it opens `https://oisy.com` for authenticated users and no longer shows the tooltip message "Wallet link is not configured" in the default deployment.
Expose the points system in the frontend profile/registration area so an authenticated user can view and manage their points from their own profile.
Re-run the Internet Computer deployment (`dfx deploy --network ic`) and capture the deployed frontend and backend canister IDs from the deployment output.

Verify the deployed frontend is reachable via its canister URL on icp0.io and does not show the gateway error “Canister ID Not Resolved”, specifically addressing the previously failing URL `https://5cpxd-piaaa-aaaap-qib3q-cai.icp0.io`.

After deployment, use the in-app Deployment Info diagnostics to confirm there is no frontend canister/domain mismatch and that the backend canister ID is correctly configured/visible for mainnet usage.

new_feature_requests.summary: Create an app to register Web3 novices and build/maintain a Web3 database of registrants.
Create a registrant data model and persistent storage in the Motoko backend to serve as the 'Web3 database' of novices.
Add an optional user progression system (e.g., levels/experience) to create new kinds of user experience later.

Extend the Motoko backend data model to support an optional user progression system (experience points and derived level) that can be used to create new “level-based” experiences later, without changing existing registration and directory features.
Add backend methods that allow creating and updating level definitions (e.g., level name + required XP threshold) so new levels can be added later without redeploying the frontend.
Create a unique user ID and issue/display a badge automatically when a user logs in for the first time.
Add navigation/links and messaging that connect the app to the external Web2 site (www.dmc-technologies.fr) to explain the project objective (creating an ICP real-world network).
Add an Events (or Coming Soon) page describing that the next step of the Web3/ICP network is coming soon.

Add backend support to automatically issue and persist a unique user ID and a badge for each principal the first time they authenticate (first login), and provide APIs to read this information on subsequent logins.
Deploy the app live (to ICP) and provide the resulting canister/frontend address (URL) to access it.
Add a new visualization page showing a digital world/planet where each new registrant appears as an inhabitant, and the planet displays the growing inhabitant count equal to total app signups.
Allow users to access their OISY wallet from within the app (OISY wallet integration / deep link / embedded access flow).
Add a points system that can be managed from the user's profile (ability to view and manage points).
Add a backend points system tied to the authenticated principal, including APIs to read and update the caller’s points, so points can be managed from the user’s profile.

projectName: Web3 Novice Registration App with On-Chain Registrant Database
